name: Science, Technology and Society
description: The focus of this lecture course will be on the varied social contexts of the emergence, development and consequences of science and technology in the modern world. In addition to critical sociological pespectives on science and technology, possible topics could include genomics, reproductive technologies, surveillance, the internet and social media, domestic technology, warfare, nuclear technologies, etc. [24L]
prerequisites: SOC205H5/231H5, 221H5, 222H5, 1.0 SOC credit at the 300 level
